passages.text: The question 'Who am I?' is not really meant to get an answer, the question 'Who am I?' is meant to dissolve the questioner.
passages.context: Self-inquiry isn't seeking information — it's dissolution. The question destroys the asker.

passages.text: Your own Self-Realization is the greatest service you can render the world.
passages.context: Not activism but awakening. The best you can do for others: realize yourself.

passages.text: Silence is the true teaching. It is the perfect teaching. It is suited only for the most advanced seeker.
passages.context: Words are concession to beginners. The real teaching is wordless. Silence transmits directly.

passages.text: There is neither creation nor destruction, neither destiny nor free will, neither path nor achievement. This is the final truth.
passages.context: Ultimate perspective dissolves all categories. Neither this nor that — beyond all dualities.

passages.text: The degree of freedom from unwanted thoughts and the degree of concentration on a single thought are the measures to gauge spiritual progress.
passages.context: Spiritual progress measured simply: fewer unwanted thoughts, more single-pointed attention.

passages.text: Mind is consciousness which has put on limitations. You are originally unlimited and perfect. Later you take on limitations and become the mind.
passages.context: Mind is contracted consciousness. You're not originally limited — you became so. Return to original state.

passages.text: No one succeeds without effort. Mind control is not your birthright. Those who succeed owe their success to their perseverance.
passages.context: Enlightenment isn't automatic. Even Ramana says: effort required. Persevere.

passages.text: Wanting to reform the world without discovering one's true self is like trying to cover the world with leather to avoid the pain of walking on stones and thorns.
passages.context: Fix yourself before fixing the world. It's easier to wear shoes than pave the earth.

passages.text: The state we call realization is simply being oneself, not knowing anything or becoming anything.
passages.context: Realization isn't achievement. It's stopping the attempt to be something else. Just be what you are.

passages.text: Why should you trouble yourself about the future? You do not even properly know about the present. Take care of the present; the future will take care of itself.
passages.context: Future-worry is presumptuous. You don't even know the present. Handle now; later handles itself.

passages.text: Happiness is your nature. It is not wrong to desire it. What is wrong is seeking it outside when it is inside.
passages.context: Desiring happiness is fine — it's your nature calling. The error is direction: outside instead of inside.

passages.text: You need not aspire for or get any new state. Get rid of your present thoughts, that is all.
passages.context: Nothing to gain, nothing to become. Just drop what obscures. The Self is already there.

passages.text: The mind turned inwards is the Self; turned outwards, it becomes the ego and all the world.
passages.context: Same mind, different directions. Turned in: Self. Turned out: ego and world. Direction determines all.

passages.text: Realisation is not acquisition of anything new nor is it a new faculty. It is only removal of all camouflage.
passages.context: Nothing to get. Just remove what covers. The Self isn't attained — it's revealed by removing disguise.

passages.text: That which is not present in deep dreamless sleep is not real.
passages.context: Test of reality: what persists in deep sleep? The world disappears. What remains is real.

passages.text: Let what comes come, let what goes go. Find out what remains.
passages.context: Don't grasp or reject. Allow movement. Then look: what doesn't come or go? That's the Self.

passages.text: If you go on working with the light available, you will meet your Master, as he himself will be seeking you.
passages.context: Work with what you have. The teacher seeks the ready student. Readiness attracts guidance.

passages.text: The explorers seek happiness in finding curiosities, climbing mountains, going to the bottom of the sea, but everyone knows this is not the way to find happiness.
passages.context: External exploration doesn't find happiness. Everyone knows this, yet everyone keeps looking outside.

passages.text: There is no greater mystery than this: being Reality ourselves, we seek to gain Reality.
passages.context: The cosmic joke: we ARE what we're looking for. Seeking what you already are is the great mystery.

passages.text: All that is required to realize the Self is to be still.
passages.context: The entire teaching in one line: be still. Stop moving outward. In stillness, Self is obvious.
